intro: Limnanthes bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet meadows and marshy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Limnanthes bakeri is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
